result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan S. Hutchison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment or good faith effort to obtain full time employment.

DNA sample and surcharge (to be paid from prison wages - condition of extended supervision once released).
Any assessment/treatment as recommended by agent. 
Eligible for CIP and SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called:  8:43 am

12CF9 and 14CF139

State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard
Defendant appears in custody w/Atty Dan Cveykus

Date and time set for sentencing hearing on revocation in 12CF9 and plea/sentencing hearing in 14CF139.  State recites joint recommendation.  COURT enters judgment on 12CF9 and sentences to 2 years prison, 1 year incarceration, 1 year extended supervision, concurrent to 14CF139, eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse, 263 days credit, and court costs (to be paid from prison wages - condition of extended supervision once released.)

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 
PLEA: No Contest
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Cveykus requests stay of sentence.  Defendant addresses Court.  COURT denies furlough.

COURT ORDERS: 14CF139 - 6 years prison, 2 years incarceration, 4 years extended supervsion, 91 days credit, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge (to be paid from prison wages - condition of extended supervision once released), any assessment/treatment as recommended by agent, full time employment or good faith effort to obtain full time employment, and eligilbe for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse.
